item.title: GOP Pollster: The NRA Isn't Listening
item.description: Frank Luntz, GOP Pollster: The NRA Isn't Listening With Proposal For Armed Guards At Schools http://t.co/CaOr3t98
item.content:encoded: Frank Luntz, GOP Pollster: The NRA Isn't Listening With Proposal For Armed Guards At Schools http://t.co/CaOr3t98 Frank Luntz, a top Republican strategist and pollster, said Wednesday that the National Rifle Association's recent calls for armed guards to be stationed at every school in the wake of the Newtown, Conn. massacre suggested the organization isn't listening to public opinion on the issue. “The public wants guns out of the schools, not in the schools, and they're not asking for a security official or someone else," Luntz said on CBS’s “This Morning,” responding to a proposal first floated by top NRA lobbyist Wayne LaPierre during a press conference last week. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.content:encoded: Quentin Tarantino challenged @mikeryan to a debate about 'Django Unchained.' Here are the results http://t.co/TwER83UZ When Quentin Tarantino sent word that he wanted to speak to me personally about my review of his latest movie, "Django Unchained," I was pretty sure he intended to yell at me. item.title: Chinese man drives car into students, injuring 13
item.description: Man distraught over daughter's murder mows down 23 middle-school students... http://t.co/WI5Cr4PE
item.content:encoded: Man distraught over daughter's murder mows down 23 middle-school students... http://t.co/WI5Cr4PE Citing eyewitnesses, the Beijing-based state-run Jinghua Times said the accident occurred when students were leaving school for noon break and that the car accelerated and knocked down students, many of whom were on bikes. On Dec. 14, a Chinese man took a kitchen knife and went on a stabbing spree that left 23 students wounded in an elementary school in Henan province. Several of the attacks have been sparked by grudges, which some experts say shows that the violence stems from simmering and widespread frustration over the growing wealth gap, corruption and too few legal channels for people who have grievances., Citing eyewitnesses, the Beijing-based state-run Jinghua Times said the accident occurred when students were leaving school for noon break and that the car accelerated and knocked down students, many of whom were on bikes. On Dec. 14, a Chinese man took a kitchen knife and went on a stabbing spree that left 23 students wounded in an elementary school in Henan province. Several of the attacks have been sparked by grudges, which some experts say shows that the violence stems from simmering and widespread frustration over the growing wealth gap, corruption and too few legal channels for people who have grievances. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: sfgate.com

item.title: 女性警官に性的発言 男性警部処分 香川県警
item.description: 女性警官に性的発言 男性警部処分 香川県警 http://t.co/UNtN2m63
item.content:encoded: 女性警官に性的発言　男性警部処分　香川県警 http://t.co/UNtN2m63 四国管区警察局に出向中の香川県警の４０代男性警部が、懇親会で他県警の女性警察官にセクハラ発言をし、局長訓戒処分を受けていたことが２６日、分かった。処分は２０日付… Link - Trackbacks
